PlainLanguage.desc: Alters Index.
Rows retrieved by %%c0 are combined and rows common to all are returned.
A logical AND operation was performed on the bitmaps from %%c0.
Compacts a bitmap index.
Converts column values to a bitmap.
The bitmaps from %%c0 were converted to ROWIDs and distinct row counts were returned.
Rows retrieved in %%c0 were converted to bitmaps.
The bitmaps returned from %%c0 were converted to ROWIDs.
Rows were retrieved from the bitmap index %%on.
Accesses all entries in a bitmap index.
All the entries in the bitmap index %%on were accessed.
Some of the entries in the bitmap index %%on were accessed.
Rows in the bitmap index %%on matching a specific value were accessed.
Updates a bitmap join index after statement execution.
Updates a bitmap index after statement execution as seen in V$SQL_PLAN view.
For each row retrieved from %%c1, perform the bitmap operation in %%c2.
The bitmaps from %%c0 were merged into a single bitmap.
Retrieves rows from a first bitmat index that are not in a second bitmap index.
A logical OR operation was performed on the bitmaps from %%c0.
Reads frequently accessed data during statement execution into private memory to reduce overhead.
Retrieves a collection of rows from table functions created using PL/SQL.
All distinct rows from %%c0 were returned.
Starting with the row identified in %%c1 perform a hierarchial query using %%c2 and %%c3.
Executes a hierarchical self-join.
The rows in the result set from %%c1 were counted.
Processing was stopped when the specified number of rows from %%c1 were processed.
Creates a table using selected information from another table.
Creates index.
Creates table.
Joins a view or table from the left and a cube from the right.
Uses an Anti-Join to query a view or table from the left and a cube from the right.
Uses a Single-Sided Null-Aware Anti-Join for a view or table from the left and a cube from the right. The right join column (cube side) is NOT NULL.
Uses an Outer Join to query a view or table from the left and a cube from the right.
Uses a RIGHT Semi-Join to query to query a view or table from the left and a cube from the right.
Retrieves cube organized data with inner join operations.
Retrieves data from at least one dimension of a cube with outer join operations while retrieving the rest of the dimensions of a cube with inner join operations.
Retrieves cube organized data with outer join operations.
Data Definition Language statements that display in the V$SQL_PLAN view.
Rows were deleted.
Rows were deleted.
Rows were remotely deleted.
Rows were retrieved using a domain index %%on.
Retrieves data from an external table.
Retrieves all data from an external table.
Retrieves a portion of the data from an external table.
Reduces reads to data stored in a DUAL table.
An operation used during Frequent Itemset Counting.
An operation used during Frequent Itemset Counting.
An operation used during Frequent Itemset Counting.
An operation used during Frequent Itemset Counting.
For the rows returned by %%c1, filter out rows depending on filter criteria.
Only the first row of the result set from %%c1 was processed.

PlainLanguage.Desc: Rows in the fixed table %%on are read.

PlainLanguage.desc: Reads fixed table %%on using index column.

PlainLanguage.Desc: Every row in the fixed table %%on is read.
Rows in the fixed table %%on are read.

PlainLanguage.desc: Lock the rows returned by %%c0.
Keeps track of the number of times a frequent itemset is used.
Oraganizes data into a cube.

PlainLanguage.Desc: Indicates a scan slave accessed data in a parallel execution plan.

PlainLanguage.desc: Indexes and retrieves rows using hashing, and then organizes rows into groups.
Indexes and retrieves rows using hashing, and then organizes rows into groups in a pivot table.
Indexes and retrieves distinct rows using hashing.
The result sets from %%c0 were joined (hash).
Rows from %%c1 which matched rows from %%c2 were eliminated (hash anti-join).
Joins buffered rows from %%c1 that match buffered rows from %%c2.
Rows from %%c1 which matched rows from %%c2 were returned (hash join).
Rows from %%c1 which matched rows from %%c2 were returned (hash join).
Uses a hash right outer join.
Uses a hash right antijoin.
Uses a hash right semijoin.
Rows from %%c1 which matched rows from %%c2 were returned (hash join).
Rows were retrieved by performing a fast read of all index records in %%on.
Rows were retrieved by performing a sequential read of all records in index %%on in ascending order.
Rows were retrieved by performing a sequential read of all records in index %%on in descending order.
All records of index %%on were scanned to support a MIN/MAX operation.
One or more rows were retrieved using index %%on. The index was scanned in ascending order.
One or more rows were retrieved using index %%on. The index was scanned in descending order.
The index %%on was scanned to support a MIN/MAX operation.
Retrieves rows by performing a fast read on a portion of the index records.
Rows were retrieved from concatenated index %%on without using the leading column(s).
Retrieves rows from a concatenated index without using the leading column in descending order.
Rows were retrieved using the unique index %%on.
Builds an index where the ROWIDs are associated with the table.
The operation in %%c1 was repeated for each of the values in an IN list.
Combines and repeats similar operations for each value of the IN list.
Rows were inserted.
Rows were inserted.
Rows were remotely inserted.
Return all rows which are included in all of the results sets returned by %%c0.
Indicates data was inserted using multi-table insert function.
The rows from %%c1 were inserted into %%on using direct-load insert.
Retrieves data from a materialized view based on index ROWIDs.
Retrieves data from a materialized view based on a provided range of ROWIDs.
Retrieves data from a materialized view based on a specific ROWID.
Retrieves data based on a full table scan of a materialized view.
Retrieves data based on a full table sample scan of a materialized view.
Retrieves data based on a full table sample scan for a provided range of ROWIDs of a materialized view.
Retrieves data from a materialized view based on global index ROWIDs after a query rewrite.
Retrieves data from a materialized view based on index ROWIDs after a query rewrite.
Retrieves data from a materialized view based on local index ROWIDs after a query rewrite.
Retrieves data from a materialized view based on a provided range of ROWIDs after a query rewrite.
Access method when user-supplied ROWIDs are used to locate materialized view rows.
Retrieves data using an index cluster key from a materialized view after a query rewrite.
Retrieves data based on a full table scan of a materialized view after a query rewrite.
Retrieves data based on a full table sample scan of a materialized view after a query rewrite.
Use to retrieve sampled rows from a materialized view when based on a ROWID range.
Retrieves data using a hash cluster key from a materialized view after a query rewrite.
Rows were merged.
Rows were merged.
Rows were remotely merged.
Join the sorted results sets provided from %%c0.
Rows from %%c1 which matched rows from %%c2 were eliminated (merge anti-join).
Every row in %%c1 was joined to every row in %%c2.
Join the results sets provided from %%c0 If there are not matching rows from %%c2 return null values for those columns.
Rows from %%c1 which matched rows from %%c2 were returned (hash join).
Return all rows from %%c1 which do not also appear in %%c2.
Inserts data into multiple tables.
For each row retrieved by %%c1, the operation in %%c2 was performed to find a matching row.
For each row returned by %%c1 get the matching row from %%c2 If there are not matching rows from %%c2 return nulls for those columns.
For each row returned by %%c1 get the matching row from %%c2 If there are not matching rows from %%c2 return nulls for those columns.
For each row returned by %%c1 get the matching row from %%c2 If there are not matching rows from %%c2 return nulls for those columns.
Retrieves rows from different tables using a partition outer join operation.
For each row returned by %%c1 get the matching row from %%c2 If there are not matching rows from %%c2 return nulls for those columns.
All partitions of %%c0 were accessed.
The operations in %%c0 were performed on multiple partitions of %%on.
Does not perform the operation on any partition in the table.
A range of partitions of %%c0 were accessed based on the values in the IN List.
The partition to be accessed in %%c0 is empty.
Use to access multiple partitions (a subset).
The operations in %%c0 were performed on a single partitions of %%on.
Does not perform the operation on any partition in the table.
Does not perform the operation on any partition in the table.
Performs the operation on all table partitions in a disjunction.
Performs the operation on all list table partitions based on a subquery.
Does not perform the operation on any partition in the table.
A range of partitions of %%c0 were accessed.
Performs the operation on all range table partitions in a disjunction.
Performs the operation on all table partitions based on a subquery.
Retrieves data from blocks after dividing the scan process between parallel scan slaves.
Divides the statement execution process between parallel slave processes.
Retrieves data from blocks or chunks after dividing the scan process between parallel scan slaves.
Performs the operation on all table partitions after dividing the process between parallel slave processes.
Performs the operation on all hash table partitions after dividing the process between parallel slave processes.
Performs the operation on all list table partitions after dividing the process between parallel slave processes.
Performs the operation on all range table partitions after dividing the process between parallel slave processes.
Retrieves data from rows sent by child processes after dividing the scan process between parallel scan slaves.
Sends rows to parent process for scanning by parallel scan slaves.
Sends rows to local parent process for scanning by parallel scan slaves.
Sends rows to parent process for scanning by parallel scan slaves.
Sends rows based on a partition key to parent process for scanning by parallel scan slaves.
Sends ordered rows to queue coordinator process for scanning by parallel scan slaves.
Sends random rows to queue coordinator process for scanning by parallel scan slaves.
Sends a range of rows to parent process for scanning by parallel scan slaves.
Executes a statement with a recursive execution function call.
Executes a self-join operation in hierarchical fashion.
Retrieves data from a reference table.
The following SQL statement was sent to the remote site %%on: %%ot.
Rows were returned by the SELECT statement.
Rows were returned by the SELECT statement.
Rows were returned by the remote SELECT statement.
A unique sequence number was generated from the sequence %%on.
Generates a unique sequence number from a remote NEXTVAL operator.
The rows were sorted to support a group operation (MAX,MIN,AVERAGE, SUM, etc).
The rows were sorted to support a group operation (MAX,MIN,AVERAGE, SUM, etc).
Sorts rows when creating the index.
The rows were sorted in order to be grouped.
Retrieves and groups rows without sorting.
Retrieves and groups rows using the rollup operator without sorting.
Operation that sorts a set of rows into groups to query with a GROUP BY clause The PIVOT funtion is a pivot-specific optimization function for the SORT GROUP BY operator.
Retrieves and groups rows using the rollup operator.
Retrieves and groups rows using the rollup operator.
Retrieves and groups rows while limiting the query to conditions defined by the stopkey.
The rows were sorted to support the join at %%c1.
The rows were sorted to support the join at %%c1.
The results were sorted to support the ORDER BY clause.
The results were sorted to support the ORDER BY STOPKEY clause.
Sorts rows from different tables using a partition outer join operation.
The rows from %%c1 were sorted to eliminate duplicate rows.
Retrieves only unique rows without sorting.
Retrieves only unique rows while limiting the query to conditions defined by the stopkey.
Retrieves and organizes data into an AUTOMATIC ORDER SQL Model.
Retrieves and organizes data into an AUTOMATIC ORDER SQL Model using the FAST method.
Retrieves and organizes data into a SEQUENTIAL ORDER SQL Model.
Retrieves and organizes data into a SEQUENTIAL ORDER SQL Model using the FAST method.
Rows from table %%on were accessed using ROWID got from a global (cross-partition) index.
Rows from table %%on were accessed using ROWID got from an index.
Rows from table %%on were accessed using ROWID got from a local (single-partition) index.
Accesses rows in table %%on based on ROWIDs.
Rows in table %%on matching a range of ROWIDs were processed.
Rows in table %%on matching a ROWID provided by the 'user' (e.g., not from an index) were accessed.
Some rows in the clustered table %%on are read, using the cluster index.
Every row in the table %%on is read.
Some rows in the table %%on were read using the hash index.
A sampled set of rows are read from table %%on.
A sampled set of rows are read from table %%on based on a range of ROWIDs.
Indicates use of parallel execution plan.
Creates and retrieves data for a temporary table used in star transformations.
Retrieves data for a temporary table used in star transformations.
Transposes the results of GROUP BY to evaluate a PIVOT operation to produce the final pivoted data.
Return all rows from %%c0 - excluding duplicate rows.
Return all rows from %%c0 - including duplicate rows.
Combines and retrieves all rows, including duplicates, from two tables from a partitioned view.
Combines and retrieves all rows, including duplicates, from two tables using predicte pushing.
Retrieves data from child rows only after retrieving data from all sibling rows.
Retrieves data from sibling rows only after retrieving data from all child rows.
Retrieves data from columns and transposes the data into rows.
Rows were updated.
Rows were updated.
Rows were remotely updated.
A view definition was processed, either from a stored view %%on or as defined by %%c0.
Pushes predicates into a temporary table used for storing query results.
An analytic function.
Supports an analytic function.
Supports an analytic function while executing the RANK function.
Retrieves data without sorting for an analytic function.
Retrieves data without sorting for an analytic function. Query results are limited by conditions defined by the stopkey.
Sorts data for an analytic function.
Sorts data before executing the RANK function for an analytic function.
